Consumers returned a record $890 billion

in retail goods in 2024

=

$127.14B

$890 B

2024

2022

$816.8B

$760.8B

2021

$428B

2020

Nearly 2/3 of consumers buy multiple sizes and return what doesn’t fit. This is part of the reason why return rates have increased, according to the 2024 report from National Retail Federation and Happy Returns.

2019

$309B

*Note: NRF’s 2023 study on retail returns used a different methodology to calculate the return rate that is not directly comparable to other years’ data.

 

Source: National Retail Federation and Happy Returns.

 

*Note: Retail here ncludes returning clothes, in addition to the returning of shoes and accessories.
